comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: He already has an entry in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Clifton_Thomson Here is why he was in the news in 1913: On June 5, 1913 he again was the champion. Source: books.google.com/books?id=1bkUAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA144&l... C.F. [sic] Thomson of Los Angeles, Cal., to-night is champion amateur all-round athlete of America for 1910, winning that distinction at the annual championship of the Amateur Athletic Union on Marshall Field in this city this afternoon. His score was 6,991 points, 400 less than that which captured the championship last year. Source: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9407E1D81230E2... F. C. Thomson of Los Angeles is champion amateur all-round athlete of the world for 1910 tonight, having won that distinction at the annual tournament on Marshall field in this... Source: pqasb.pqarchiver.com/boston/access/712258282.html?dids=71... I will add the new information to his Wikipedia biography.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content:
Richard Arthur Norton:

Thank you for the interesting information about F.C. Thomson and the correction on his last name. We will fix the title and update the  description.
